PageTitle: display ip source check user-bind status
FuncDef: The display ip source check user-bind status command displays IPSG binding entries and their status. The display ip source check user-bind status command displays IPSG binding entries and their status. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display ip source check user-bind status [ [ [ dynamic | static ] [ { interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | ip-address <ip-address> | mac-address <mac-address> | vlan <vlan-id> } ] [ valid | invalid ] ] | summary ] [ slot <slot-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the IPSG dynamic binding table.
-

Displays information about the IPSG static binding table.
-

Displays binding entries mapping a specified interface:
interface-type.interface-number.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

Displays binding entries mapping a specified IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays binding entries mapping a specified MAC address.
The value is in H-H-H format and an H is a hexadecimal number of 4 digits.

Displays binding entries mapping a specified VLAN ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Checks the IPSG that has taken effect.
-

Displays brief information about the binding table.
-

Displays the IPSG status in a specified slot.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display ip source check user-bind status dynamic
<HUAWEI> display ip source check user-bind status static
<HUAWEI> display ip source check user-bind status
<HUAWEI> display ip source check user-bind status summary
